metadata.name: Schwere See #115
metadata.description:
Schwere See (...which is german for "Heavy Seas") this work creates completely generative ocean worlds between the real and the surreal. what is real? when do we feel reality? i guess as with many other things, we feel reality best when we're deprived of it. That might be the reason why it never ceases to fascinate us to both exaggerate and abstract nature and reality - maybe even at the same time. that's where this work tries to go... giving my best to create realistic looking waves out of hmm... thin electron-gas..., and then disrupt those from realism by unnaturally exaggerating waveforms and abstracting the display to a few colors and lines - ...well, not so few of the latter, actually ;-) beware: this needs a good GPU (at least here in 2023) to properly run in realtime. stills can still be rendered on a low end machine with on-board graphics, but for realtime playing you'd need some proper dedicated graphics card. and of course it wont run fast (or maybe not all) on your mobile phone (except maybe on a very high end device). the different mints vary in wave shape, color, camera view, animation speed, aspect ratio, frame style, hatching density, field of view, and more. some color schemes are based on pre-chosen palettes (slightly varied though), but others are wildly random-generated. there's always some risk in randomness, but lets give the error some chance to surprise us - this is one of the many benefits of generative art. as generative art can do so much more than just generate/show an image i feel almost obliged to add the possibility to animate/inteact. however, this extra control shall not be chosen without some considerations. you don't want a strobingly wild animation above your fireplace or in a doctors waiting room. nor is it motion-wise very inspiring to have subtle image stills hanging in a dancefloor. so, by default when in animation mode (-key) the scene is very slowly and steadily changing - some pieces faster, some slower. however, by pressing you can toggle to a sped up animation of waves, clouds, and scene rotation. btw, going faster in nav-mode also speeds up the wave animation. (...so be careful when you accelerate! the ocean is not a ponyfarm.) mouse/keyboard functions: ..........rotate view .........zoom in/out ...............start animation (or append '&AnimEnable=1' to the url) +<1><2><3><4>...make png screenshot in 1/2/3/4-fold resolution

...................same as +<3> ...................toggle nav-mode - navigate/fly through scene /.........accelerate in nav-mode /.......decelerate in nav-mode /.......rotate left in nav-mode /......rotate right in nav-mode ...................fast animation mode (speeds up animation) some technical info: technically this is a raymarched scene. the distance field of the waves is constructed my many localized rotations on many different scales. for the hatching no actual lines are being drawn. it is archieved by applying periodic functions in world-position-space as halftone patterns to the actual image color. the frequency of these halftone-functions thereby depending on screen-position-derivatives.

metadata.name: pantonX.2 #20
metadata.description:
pantonX.2

I am a visual artist and have worked in the field of coding since the early years of processing.
Always loved geometric and minimalist art, bauhaus, De Stijl, Piet Mondrian, Ellsworth Kelly, Imi Knoebel -- just to name a few -- and last but not least Verner Panton, have had a big influence on my artistic work.

pantonX.2 is my second fxhash release. it's coded in p5js.
I set up a wider random range for the color arrays and the division structure, so that a 200x drop would have enough variation for not getting boring. 

"s" key is for saving

metadata.name: Biography of Ume #4
metadata.description:
„ÄÄDuring the winter months, when I do not see any flowers in the city, it is as if I have forgotten that flowers exist. Sometimes, some time after the flowers have disappeared from the world, I suddenly spot a red bud on a branch poking out from the eaves of a house. It is a time when I have become accustomed to winter and have grown too accustomed to it. I am red! I think. Red! That is the ‚Äùume" blossom. Many people think of cherry blossoms when they think of spring flowers, but my favorite spring flower is the ume blossom. It is a wonderful flower that reminds me that there are flowers in the world and that spring is coming.
„ÄÄUme blossoms are forgotten by the time the cherry blossoms bloom. I was born into this world on April 5, right on the border of when the cherry blossoms are in full bloom or not. I am born every year with the news that the cherry blossoms are in full bloom. But the plum blossoms are history. They are history and predecessors who built the world before I was born. When I am born again toward spring, I want to cherish the past. With this in mind, I created this work, wondering if I could paint the ume blossoms.
„ÄÄWhen I was making this, I felt like I was making sweets. It was a new sensation for me. The sensation of taking something that is commonplace in everyday life and cooking it in my own way was exactly like making sweets. I don't think sweets are noble. But I think they are something a little special. Above all, when sweets are placed in front of you, they bring forth a calm joy that cannot be contained from the bottom of one's heart. If there were many colors of such joy, if there were various kinds of sweets, I am sure we would be happy. This is a ume sweet. Please try it. I believe that these will become our cells and our past.

ume = Ê¢Ö
„ÄÄThis time, I put words to the color palette and shapes. It is not a universal language, but it is a special sound for me. If you want to know the meaning of the words, please ask me on twitter : @shirasu_nejio. However, I don't think that meaning is necessarily essential.

metadata.name: Maquette #133
metadata.description:
Like a photography of a city maquette with citizens.

Created in javascript / webGL using three.js and pathtracer.
May - June 2022
@arthurmchr

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Path tracing is an heavy GPU operation.
Depending on the device, it can takes a few seconds to render.
Worked on Chrome and Firefox.

In live mode :
press S to export a PNG of the rendered image.
press P to pause / resume rendering (automatically paused after 100 rendering steps).

metadata.name: Zug #194
metadata.description:
Zug is the German word for train, but it also translates to 'a force that pulls in a specific direction' which feels very fitting, though it might remain unclear in which direction exactly.

The image is build layering around 9000 transparent strokes grouped so that the resemblance of a passing train is created. Most strokes are blurred, some are repeating.

All editions share the same base color palette. From it three different palettes are derived for the light, medium and dark colors. Press 'c' to get a better idea of how this works.

Initial sketch made for the Weekly Creative Coding Challenge hosted by Rapha√´l de Courville (@Sableraph).

Commands:
f = fullscreen toggle
b = change window background color
c = color palettes overlay toggle
s = save image at 1080 x 1920 pixels
p = save image at 3240 x 5760 pixels

metadata.name: Alienpillars #89
metadata.description:
"A rare type of bug that supposedly arrived on a cargo ship is destroying crops on planet Uctumi, in the binary system of Extronium. A wide variety of very resistant subspecies has mutated and it is necessary to study and identify all of them to obtain a gen-activated pesticide that will work on all of their variations. The pest department of the Uctumi central government is working hard on it, and they say that these strange critters are probably related to similar species that inhabited the planet Earth of the Solar system a long time ago and have spread over the galaxy."

My second piece using the p5.js raymarcher I wrote. The drawing is made of circles and lines based on the 3D data. I wanted to try something hairy as it's easy to draw lines aligned to the surface normal with this method. I also used a shader for the frame and the glitchy/sketch features.

Features 

body color: green-red-purple-yellow-blue-black
body tone: dark-light
spots color: orange-green-blue-yellow-white
hair tips: yes-no
hair #1: short-medium-long
hair #2: short-medium-long
head size: small-medium-large
head shape: long-spherical-wide
glitchy mode: 10% chance
sketch mode: 9% chance

metadata.name: Lost in multidimensional planes #62
metadata.description:
The universe as we know it has three dimensions of space (length, width and depth) and one of time. However, there's the mind-bending possibility that many more dimensions exist out there‚Ä¶
"Lost in multidimensional planes" is an artistic exploration of visualizing 356 in silico created universes with more than 4 dimensions. 

----
- Made entirely with code in p5js.
- Press "P" to export an PNG raster image.
- Will take several seconds to render, and likely more on mid-range mobile CPUs.
- Tested on Chrome, Brave and Edge.

-	Minters will receive 20% of royalties from the secondary market.

metadata.name: Special Token [RESERVE PASS] #7
metadata.description:
Back when I was a researcher at a human-computer interaction lab, I parked in the adjacent neighborhood and rode the city bus into campus.

Usually this was a pretty uneventful affair.

One spring day though, the bus was packed and I had to stand right up front by the driver. Despite trying to appear busy enough not to be bothered, the driver struck up a conversation.

At some point in the short trip, we stopped at a red light. It was then that he made an off-hand comment that I've remembered ever since.

‚ÄúThe moment between when the light turns green and when I realize it, that‚Äôs where my soul resides.‚Äù

I‚Äôm not sure how you‚Äôre supposed to respond to that. But nevertheless it smacked me.

So: do not consider each of these my personal signature as an artist, developer, and tinkerer.

Do consider them an expended shard of my soul and the culmination of experiences that have led up to this moment.

This is the light turning green.

---

THIS TOKEN IS A RESERVE PASS (it‚Äôs ‚ú®special‚ú®)

- This token will function as a reserve pass for any future drop on fx(hash) that has a total edition size of > 100 (ie, most of my drops, other than dedicated ‚Äúsketch‚Äù projects that may have intentionally fewer editions)

- Future reserves will be limited to holders of this token, and holding this token will guarantee you a dedicated 24 hour reserve spot on such projects.

- Holding any token from my prior projects will make you eligible to mint from this drop (I will take a final snapshot ~1 hr prior to drop).

- I have created an edition size of 60, but only 40 will be open for minting at this time. I‚Äôll reserve the remainder for issuing or burning at my discretion.

- I will also airdrop ~9 editions to the top collectors of my previous projects (consider Twitter to be the source of info on this prior to the drop)

WHY?

I don‚Äôt like the idea of picking and choosing who gets a reserve and who doesn‚Äôt.

I love you all üôè

---

- Made with p5JS
- Press ‚Äús‚Äù to save png

metadata.name: Hope #270
metadata.description:
Ups, downs, and everything in between. This series is about prevailing hope in the journey of life.
Each brush stroke is meant to elicit perspective, connectivity, beauty, and hope.

Features:
F  -  Fullscreen
S  -  Save image
2/4/6/8/0  -  Change image resolution (press number key and then reload in live view, please wait a few seconds for higher resolutions to load)

Designed in p5js
Original artwork, 2022 by fauxjebus and Dave Siegel

‚ÄúTo live without hope is to cease to live.‚Äù
- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

metadata.name: Coronado #388
metadata.description:
This series is about the beauty and charm of imperfection, chaos amidst order, and letting go. It's about knowing that however much control we think we may have, things can all fall apart or burst into something unexpectedly wonderful at any moment, even without our hands tightly on the reigns.

Please see fxtext article linked from main project page for more background on the project and rendering notes.

Some key commands in live mode:

G : Toggle grain
S : Save current resolution
1 : 4000x5000
2 : 6000x7500
3 : 8000x10000
4 : 10000x12500
5 : 12000x15000
6 : 14000x17500
(1-6 work best on Chrome)
(rendering takes longer as resolution increases)

metadata.name: Swedish Forest #74
metadata.description:
If I had to choose a place where time was frozen and where I could contemplate the landscape for eternity this place would be a scandinavian forest.
I have been contemplating these kind of landscape for a very long time both in Sweden and in the Pyrenees where the ecosystem is very similar.
This project generates an illustration of a scandinavian forest in many different situations. At day and at night, in every season of the year, next to a lake or not, with steep hills or at the plains, snowing, with preponderance of some plant species over others, etc.
The artwork is also drawn in various paint modes and layouts.

The sun or the moon may be visible, the moon shows always the actual moon phase based on the current date.
The reflection on the lake is the fxhash morse endcoded.


Developed in vanilla js using svg and canvas
Rendering can be unresponsive on slow devices
Click or touch to switch to Parallax mode, just move the mouse or finger.


[S] Download in SVG format
[D] Download in PNG format

Features:

Layout: Landscape, Portrait, Square
PredominantSpecies: Blueberry, Lingonberry, Calluna, Rocks, None
Trees: Mixed, PinesAndFirs, Birches, None
Season: Spring, Summer, Fall, Winter
DayNight: Day, Night
PaintStyle: Normal, Stroke, Paint, WhiteOnBlack, BlackOnWhite
ColorStyle: Normal, Crazy
HasLake: True, False
HasTrees: None, Few, Many, Crowded

Created by Daniel Juli√† Lundgren, fxhash: danieljulia.tez, twitter: @daniel_julia. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: Ichigo #155
metadata.description:
This generator is named 'Ichigo' (Ëã∫/ „ÅÑ„Å°„Åî), the Japanese word for 'strawberry'. 

Seeing each iteration from a suitable distance, small dots (to me, reminiscent of strawberry seeds) overlay different sequences of geometric repetitions, implying a sense of texture, grittiness and irregularity. 

By looking closer however, it becomes apparent to the viewer that the majority of the composition is in fact government by orderly elements, in this case grids of dots. 

This discovery invites the viewer to consider the output in front of them at different levels, near and far. At what point do you feel the dots begin to dissolve into a texture? When do you stop noticing the dots and instead begin to perceive the overall composition?

These questions are posed in a similar fashion as with meditation; at what point does something become something else? When does an in-breath become an out-breath and vice versa? 

Contemplation on simple questions like these can open a small portal into stillness and mindfulness by taking time to slowly observe our responses. 

23 palettes are included, each named after different areas of Tokyo. 

Press 'S' to download a full size 6000px x 6000px PNG output. 

As always, much gratitude and enjoy your piece.
